description: Design a data structure that follows the constraints of a Least Recently Used (LRU) cache. Implement the LRUCache class with get(key) and put(key, value) operations. get(key) returns the value of the key if it exists, otherwise returns -1. put(key, value) updates or inserts the key-value pair; if the number of keys exceeds the capacity from this operation, evict the least recently used key. Both operations must run in O(1) average time complexity.

examples.explanation: LRUCache(2): capacity=2. put(1,1), put(2,2), get(1)=1, put(3,3) evicts key 2, get(2)=-1, put(4,4) evicts key 1, get(1)=-1, get(3)=3, get(4)=4.

constraints: At most 2 * 10^5 calls will be made to get and put
